title: Funding for libraries and literacy improvement projects, Sheffield City Council

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please supply information for each year: 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023
1) Which organisations provide you with funding for the provision of libraries and literacy improvement projects? Please list these organisations.
2) How much money do each of these organisations provide to you for the provision of libraries and literacy improvement projects?  Please list each organisation and amount provided by each.
3) For each organisation, please state the amount of money allocated for
a. infrastructure
b. staff costs
c. book purchases
d. literacy related projects
e. everything else
4) What are the controls on how this money is spent?
5) What are the reporting requirements for this spend?
Yours faithfully,
Sharon Cox

Dear Sharon Cox,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Funding for
libraries and literacy improvement projects which we received on
10/11/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 09/12/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI, Sheffield City Council,
Further to my FOI request above, to help you to fully answer my questions I am submitting them below in a more detailed format in the hope that this will help you to fully answer my questions.
Funding for libraries and literacy improvement projects:
Please supply information for each year: 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023
1. Where does your funding for the provision of libraries and literacy improvement projects come from?  Please list all the organisations which provide funding.  Please include in your list any of the following organisations which apply in your case:
a) any government bodies such as the Dept for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport (DCMS), Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government (HCLG), Arts Council England (ACE)
b) any charities which are funded by DCMS, HCLG or ACE including, but not limited to, Libraries Connected, The Reading Agency, Libraries Unlimited
c) Any other organisations which provide you with funding that are not included in the above
Please list these organisations.
2) How much money do each of these organisations who provide you with funding provide to you for the provision of libraries and literacy improvement projects?   Please list each organisation and amount provided by each organisation.
3) For each organisation in your list, please state the amount of money allocated for
a. infrastructure
b. staff costs
c. book purchases
d. literacy related projects
e. everything else
4) What are the controls on how this money is spent?
5) What are the reporting requirements for this spend?
Thank you.
Yours sincerely,
Sharon Cox

Thank you for your request for information relating to Funding for

Hello, please see the Library services response to this FOI.
1. Where does your funding for the provision of libraries and literacy
improvement projects come from?  Please list all the organisations which
provide funding.  Please include in your list any of the following
organisations which apply in your case:
a. any government bodies such as the Dept for Digital, Culture, Media and
Sport (DCMS) = £0
b. Ministry of Housing, Communities & Local Government (HCLG) = £0
c. Arts Council England (ACE)  see table below
d. any charities which are funded by DCMS, HCLG or ACE including, but not
limited to, Libraries Connected, The Reading Agency, Libraries
Unlimited see table below
e. Any other organisations which provide you with funding that are not
included in the above, See table below
Source Year (approximation) Amount For what
The Reading Agency 2020 £3,000 Literacy related project
Libraries Connected 2020 £4,000 Other (board game
library)
Libraries Connected 2022 £1,000 Literacy related project
Libraries Connected 2022 £7,000 Literacy related project
Better World Books 2022 £2,000 Book purchases
Arts Council England 2023 £1,600 Literacy related project
Arts Council England 2022 £340k Other (LIF capital
funding for new library
entrance)
2) How much money do each of these organisations who provide you with
funding provide to you for the provision of libraries and literacy
improvement projects?   Please list each organisation and amount provided
by each organisation.
3) For each organisation in your list, please state the amount of money
allocated for
a. infrastructure
b. staff costs
c. book purchases
d. literacy related projects
e. everything else
See table
4) What are the controls on how this money is spent?
Principally restricted funding only to be spent in line with grant
conditions/grant purpose.
5) What are the reporting requirements for this spend?
We are no longer reporting on any of this funding, and do not hold this
information.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
